To make sure colors display correctly: set t_Co=256, set termguicolors. Syntax highlighting customisation available through :hi <group>. Commands such as :highlight LineNr guifg=<color> and :highlight StatusLine guibg=<background_color> allows to make nuanced adjustments.

items.text: VIM User Manual by Bram Moolenaar, 2023
items.note: The definitive, task-oriented guide included with Vim. It's accessible via Vim itself and online.
This tutorial takes a task oriented approach allowing you to learn only the commands that make your job easier.

items.text: Learning the vi and Vim Editors by Arnold Robbins, Elbert Hannah, Linda Lamb, 2022
items.note: A comprehensive guide covering both vi and vim, updated for modern platforms. Also covers other vi clones like nvi, elvis, and vile.

items.text: Painless Vim: A Sane Person’s Guide by Nate Dickson, 2017
items.note: A beginner-friendly, step-by-step journey through Vim.

items.text: Gourmet Vim Cookbook by Igor Irianto, 2021
items.note: 100+ practical Vim examples. Designed to introduce lesser-known features.

items.text: Use Vim Like a Pro by Tim Ottinger, 2014
items.note: A small but purposeful micro‑book licensed under Creative Commons.

items.text: Vim Reference Guide by Sundeep Agarwal, 2024
items.note: A concise, cheatsheet-style guide aimed at beginner to intermediate users.
A masterclass in efficient editing via over 120 well-crafted tips.

items.text: Learn Vimscript the Hard Way by Steve Losh, 2013
items.note: A practical, in-depth guide to learning Vimscript through hands-on coding, aimed at users ready to customize and extend Vim.

items.text: Mastering Vim Quickly by Jovica Ilic, 2018
items.note: A fast-paced guide designed to help mastering Vim's core features and workflows.

items.text: The VimL Primer by Benjamin Klein, 2015
items.note: An accessible introduction to VimL (Vimscript, the built-in scripting language).
Recipes for doing many simple and not so simple things in Vim.
